_header: I love good all that is no fail
_description: A cryptogram containing the beloved’s name — two quatrains

BLAdd38666.Transcription:
I loue good alle þat ys no fayle by þis ye may fynde
                    hyrWalke where I schall on grounde or wall no erthly thynge beterYn
                    þis ys mayd playne my swete hartes name saue god none can vs
                    departeWherefore I say & suer be sche may sche may sche hath my hole
                    hart
BLAdd38666.Editions:
Boffey,  Julia. 
             “Two Unnoticed Love-lyrics from the Early Sixteenth Century.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 28 [226] (1981): 20-21: 21.
